sub_title: Impact Programmes & Sustainability Director at Global Fashion Agenda
summary:
Since kicking off my career in fashion with a meeting at the Amsterdam ‘Artis’ zoo over 10 years ago, I have dedicated my work life to the sustainable transformation of the apparel industry. My vision is of a circular industry that is inclusive, transparent and regenerative.

As an experienced project leader, I have successfully developed and delivered sustainability programmes and work of products from concept to execution for both public and professional audiences around this topic. Examples of which include: Educational materials, workshops, websites/platforms, transparency tools, grievance mechanisms, a consumer-facing carbon calculation tool, communication campaigns, guidebooks, exhibitions, talk shows and competitions. 

Through my various roles, I seized the opportunity to develop my facilitation skills. I enjoy engaging with and managing different stakeholder groups, public-private partnerships and realising effective cross disciplinary collaborations to tackle challenges of scale. 

My interests lie in cross disciplinary collaborations, engaging communication, extraordinary experiences and new approaches to fashion. I have a broad skillset, in-depth knowledge, an influential network and meticulous work ethic, and would describe myself as being a self-motivated, positive and energetic colleague.


Holly Syrett 
mail: holly@globalfashionagenda.com

treasury_media:
[{'url': 'https://www.weforum.org/events/world-economic-forum-annual-meeting-2020/sessions/fashion-for-tomorrow/', 'title': 'Redesigning Fashion for a Sustainable Future', 'description': 'The global economy stands to gain more than $177 billion each year through more efficient use of resources and improved working conditions. How can leaders join forces to increase transparency, circularity and inclusivity in the clothing supply chain?...', 'image': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/sync/C4D27AQFAH6YdlA1X-g/articleshare-shrink_800/0/1692067315978?e=1692889200&v=beta&t=F8QkW8bJYpJC49piIBDBLKr18KIxVKce0UJw8t0br8o'}, {'url': None, 'title': 'WEF Panel on the Future of Fashion', 'description': None, 'image': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4E2DAQFUpCoRHWuB1A/profile-treasury-image-shrink_8192_8192/0/1597951215998?e=1692889200&v=beta&t=qHh4ejIa115HCiLNuKuQootrRO3BZ05yr9r2ABFaJSI'}, {'url': 'https://vimeo.com/299431575', 'title': 'Fashion Revolution at the Institut Suédois Paris - TALK #1', 'description': 'Panel on: Fashion, Trust & Transparency
Focus on the role of trust and transparency in industry policies and corporate commitment for reshaping the fashion industry in relation to its impact on people and the planet.
What role, for example, do trust and collaboration have in creating circular business models? What
is the role of public stakeholders in transparent triple helix collaboration? What role do trust and
transparency play in the pace of fashion consumption?', 'image': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/sync/C5627AQE1FMhc3ESioA/articleshare-shrink_800/0/1691180965689?e=1692889200&v=beta&t=5rAJ2Qw58OJJh-UpGvrixpNq5KpI1eG6PRUpBCmowwk'}, {'url': 'https://vimeo.com/152279472', 'title': 'Pulp Fabrics', 'description': "A glimpse of the SLOW fashion presentation featuring PULP by Natalie de Koning during Fashion Week in Amsterdam. During the presentation, two projects were premiered: Pulp fabrics - a new material platform for repurposed and upcycled materials - and the capsule collection PULP by Natalie de Koning, featuring garments that can't be bought in the traditional sense, but that can be made with the designer during workshops.

With thanks to the Amsterdam Fund for the Arts", 'image': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/sync/C4E27AQEDMROIr9E_-g/articleshare-shrink_800/0/1691391056730?e=1692889200&v=beta&t=kwqyzOaflDp61NeRvd8NjrG_iVyCsN88GQ4zlB97i4Q'}, {'url': 'https://vimeo.com/188812708', 'title': 'Modebelofte 2016', 'description': 'Fiercely innovative international fashion exhibition realised in collaboration with You Are Here, Niek Pulles and Harm Rensink during Dutch Design Week. 

With o.a. de Bijenkorf, Mansveld Expotech, Dutch Design Week, Heijmans and many more. 

www.modebelofte.com', 'image': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/sync/C5627AQH3n2aDWQs-Bg/articleshare-shrink_800/0/1691391057252?e=1692889200&v=beta&t=LkSU1HAKWLVzBVUgAkJzRTF5SMKa3Fve6YUAZFLtPmU'}, {'url': 'https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RH1w-Azt3z8', 'title': 'DJ100 - OneWorld / Bedrock interview', 'description': "Each year a jury of professionals from varying backgrounds, chooses the one hundred most inspiring and innovative young 'sustainable' leaders of the Netherlands. A diverse group of both young entrepreneurs, young professionals and students who have a positive impact. The design is made by LOLA landscape architects. A newly designed lake and four stars will be the central features of the plan. The stars act as squares that connect the buildings and serve as central points for all outdoor activities. 

I joined an interdisciplinary team with LOLA landscape architects, WGF Objekt (technical landscape consultant) WPW (building and construction engineers) Competition team: Frans Boots (technical landscape consultant) Chris Kabel (product designer) ARUP (engineering consultant, sustainability),IMGplus (3D, visualizations) and contributed to the winning design with a fashion and branding perspective.

', 'issuer': 'Adidas', 'date': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}}, {'title': 'Duurzame Jonge 100', 'description': "Each year a jury chooses the one hundred most inspiring and innovative young 'sustainable' leaders of the Netherlands. ", 'issuer': 'Sustainable Motion', 'date': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}}, {'title': 'Best of Dutch Design Week Award', 'description': 'For the first time in 2015 during the Dutch Design Awards, there was a prize for the most surprising and/or impressive presentation to express extra appreciation for the designers and exhibition creators who make DDW a success. 

The ambassadors of Dutch Design Week, Koert van Mensvoort, Rianne Makkink and Jurgen Bey awarded the Best of Dutch Design Week Award to ‘Modebelofte: Performing Advancers’ by concept store You Are Here, curated by designers Niek Pulles and Harm Rensink. The project was praised for its special presentation in an extraordinary location (the Philips Stadium); for the fine entrepreneurship of all those involved; and for the organisers’ effort and generosity towards the fashion talent taking part in the exhibition. ', 'issuer': 'Dutch Design Week', 'date': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}}, {'title': 'Best International Fashion Week 2011', 'description': "Amsterdam Fashion Week was awarded 'The Best International Fashion Week 2011' award by the UK-based (yet internationl) Sublime Magazine on basis of the company's pioneering initiatives focused on creating a sustainable and interdisciplinary creative industry. 

The Green Fashion Competition largely contributed to this acknowledgement", 'issuer': 'Sublime Magazine', 'date': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2011}}]

projects:
[{'title': 'High Fashion Low Countries', 'date': {'start': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}, 'end': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}}, 'description': 'In October 2012 I was invited by the Embassy of the Kingdom of the Netherlands in Belgium to be involved with the High Fashion Low Countries documentary and as the symposium host and moderator. 

High Fashion Low Countries was a collaborative project focused on the development of new ideas within fashion design around three main topics: sustainable development, the reinvention of crafts and high-technology. The project included a travelling exhibition (Amsterdam, Antwerp, Brussels and later London), a short documentary, a symposium and a magazine. The curators selected six emerging designers from Belgium and The Netherlands to create a capsule collection of three couture pieces, which were the result of exquisite craftsmanship and innovative techniques.
 
I was interviewed for the documentary (see here: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ilv08C4sDpA ) and hosted the symposium with Q&A’s and break-out sessions by among others: Sonja Noël (Owner and founder of Stijl and Haleluja, Brussels), Jocelyn Whipple (Sustainable Fashion Specialist, London), Jane Bowler (Fashion and Textiles designer, London), UPS, Freedom of Creation.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Holly', 'last_name': 'Syrett', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Impact Programmes & Sustainability Director at Global Fashion Agenda'}]}, {'title': 'Salon de Mode', 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2009}, 'end': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2010}}, 'description': 'Salon de Mode was an initiative that I set up together with informal investor Jos Konickx and the Rabobank. Salon de Mode was an interactive event format aimed at bridging the gap between emerging fashion designers and independent retailers in the Netherlands. The research and pilot event formed the basis for my graduation thesis at AMFI. 
', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Holly', 'last_name': 'Syrett', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Impact Programmes & Sustainability Director at Global Fashion Agenda'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Jos', 'last_name': 'Konickx', 'name': None, 'headline': '(interim) bestuurder/directeur met een missie voor maatschappelijke en klimaatverbonden (gebieds-)ontwikkeling van bedrijven, instellingen en investeringsprojecten.'}]}]

[{'company': {'id': 3354360, 'name': 'Global Fashion Agenda', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4E0BAQEKxECEWrUgwQ/company-logo_400_400/0/1653924512181?e=1700092800&v=beta&t=LWiBEdvLFSoU2DWrmKEpx3MQW_JdOZA6bzkF6YmF0Fw', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/globalfashionagenda/', 'employees': {'start': 11, 'end': 50}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Amsterdam, North Holland, Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'company': 'Global Fashion Agenda', 'description': "As Impact Programmes & Sustainability Director at Global Fashion Agenda, I'm responsible for contributing to the strategic mission and sustainability agenda, driving GFA's impact programmes such as the Circular Fashion Partnership and ensuring strategic engagement with key stakeholders and partners.

Global Fashion Agenda is the foremost leadership forum for industry collaboration on fashion sustainability. As a thought leadership and advocacy organisation focusing on industry collaboration and public-private cooperation, the non-profit is on a mission to mobilise and guide the fashion industry to take bold and urgent action on sustainability.", 'title': 'Impact Programmes & Sustainability Director', 'employment_type': None}, {'location': None, 'date': {'start': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}, 'end': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}}, 'company': 'Global Fashion Agenda', 'description': "Global Fashion Agenda is the foremost leadership forum for industry collaboration on fashion sustainability. As a thought leadership and advocacy organisation focusing on industry collaboration and public-private cooperation, the non-profit is on a mission to mobilise and guide the fashion industry to take bold and urgent action on sustainability. 

As Senior Sustainability Manager, I'm responsible for researching, project leading and writing new and existing GFA publications, commitments and reports such as the CEO Agenda.", 'title': 'Senior Sustainability Manager', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 2766177, 'name': 'Sustainable Apparel Coalition', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4E0BAQFodRIIxHS0-w/company-logo_400_400/0/1519882464456?e=1700092800&v=beta&t=skDfQCHu8qWGq2M24aoRtBhiN_1aAeNY5UTZCU8MtJs', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/sustainable-apparel-coalition/', 'employees': {'start': 11, 'end': 50}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}, 'end': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Amsterdam en omgeving, Nederland', 'date': {'start': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}, 'end': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}}, 'company': 'Sustainable Apparel Coalition', 'description': '“In a world of information overload, transparency with the intent of positive impact can be a driving force for change.”

As the Project Manager of Higg Transparency, I am responsible for enabling transparency of the Higg Index – a tool used by brands, retailers and factories in the apparel, textiles and footwear industry, to measure environmental and social sustainability. 

Together with SAC members and transparency stakeholders, I facilitate the R&D processes to develop and test communication tools and guidance with which the Sustainable Apparel Coalition, its members and Higg Index users can transparently share their sustainability performance and progression. 

This work is geared at providing transparency as a new criterium for choice, enabling consumers to make considered purchasing decisions on basis of trusted sustainability information and achieving transparency and accountability throughout the value chain and of products!', 'title': 'Project Manager Higg Transparency', 'employment_type': None}, {'location': 'Amsterdam en omgeving, Nederland', 'date': {'start': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}, 'end': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}}, 'company': 'Sustainable Apparel Coalition', 'description': "The Sustainable Apparel Coalition is the apparel, footwear and home textile industry’s foremost alliance for sustainable production. Representing over 40% of the global apparel, textiles and footwear sector, the Coalition has a clear-cut vision of an industry that produces no unnecessary environmental harm and has a positive impact on the people and communities associated with its activities. 
The Higg Index is the core driver of the SAC. This suite of self-assessment tools empowers brands, retailers and facilities of all sizes, at every stage in their sustainability journey, to measure their environmental and social and labor impacts and identify areas for improvement. The Higg Index delivers a holistic overview of the sustainability performance of a product or company—a big-picture perspective that is essential for progress to be made. 
SAC is committed to enabling consumers to choose products based on trusted sustainability information by 2020 and supports its members to become transparent about sustainability performance using the Higg Index Roadmap to Transparency. 

As part of the Amsterdam-based team I'm working as a Project Manager in relation to Transparency efforts and Communication Tools.", 'title': 'Project Manager', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'GW Agency - Amsterdam', 'logo': None, 'url': None, 'employees': {'start': None, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Amsterdam', 'date': {'start': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}}, 'company': 'GW Agency - Amsterdam', 'description': 'As an independent project manager and consultant I hired and managed small teams to realise initiatives for various clients. Examples include:

•	Dutch Ministry of Health, Welfare and Sport – Project management and development of The Model’s Health Pledge platform, network and funding for ‘reporting point’ on fashion and health.
•	THNK Academy – Sustainable fashion programme development & film production.
•	Copenhagen Fashion Summit – Facilitation of panel and round table session on transparency and product environmental footprinting with the European Commission, policy makers and apparel industry executives.
•	Pure Waste – Brand positioning and sales of 100% recycled textiles in Benelux.
•	Modebelofte – Project management, PR and event production of international fashion exhibition at Dutch Design Week in 2015, 2016 and 2017.
•	Are you your self(ie)? – Development and execution of educational programme, workshops and exhibition for ‘de Haage Hogeschool’
•	Modefabriek Talks – Sustainable fashion talk show development and moderation during four trade fairs in 2017 & 2018.
•	De Droomfabriek – Project management, branding, PR and production ‘Purpose Day’.
•	Service Design Network – Dutch PR strategy development and roll-out, media-buying.', 'title': 'Founder - Sustainable Project Management & Consulting', 'employment_type': None}, {'location': 'Amsterdam en omgeving, Nederland', 'date': {'start': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}, 'end': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}}, 'company': 'GW Agency - Amsterdam', 'description': "I was appointed by the Dutch Ministry for Welfare, Health and Sport, to lead a project team and oversee the successful development and delivery of an industry pledge, platform and reporting point for misconduct to stimulate health and a healthy working environment for models. 

This project is part the national prevention programme 'Alles is Gezondheid'. Marvy Rieder (MarVie Foundation), Kim Vos (BDifferent) and Michelle den Hollander (BDifferent) are part of the project team.", 'title': "Projectmanager The Model's Health Pledge ", 'employment_type': None}, {'location': 'Amsterdam Area, Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}, 'end': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}}, 'company': 'GW Agency - Amsterdam', 'description': "The Service Design Network is bringing the 9th Service Design Global Conference to the Netherlands on 27th and 28th of October 2016. As the local Media and PR manager I'm supporting SDN's promotional activities in the Netherlands.

With an active SDN Dutch Chapter and a strong service design community in place, SDN is looking forward to more than 600 participants from all over the world  coming together to network, exchange experiences, ideas and different perspectives.", 'title': "Local Media and PR Manager Service Design Network - SDGC '16", 'employment_type': None}, {'location': 'Eindhoven Area, Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}, 'end': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}}, 'company': 'GW Agency - Amsterdam', 'description': 'As the projectmanager I was responsible for the successful development and production of the annual Modebelofte exhibition and events during Dutch Design Week. I worked closely with founder Ellen Albers, the creative team Niek Pulles and Harm Rensink and programme partners such as the Philips Stadium and de Bijenkorf warehouse to realise immersive cross-disciplinary fashion exhibitions. 

2015: Modebelofte - Performing Advancers https://neworderoffashion.com/exhibitions/performing-advancers/ 
2016: Modebelofte - Adaptive Travellers https://neworderoffashion.com/exhibitions/adaptive-travelers/

Modebelofte is an annual presentation of the brightest fashion talents, freshly graduated from
Dutch and international BA and MA courses, during Dutch Design Week in Eindhoven.', 'title': 'Project Manager Modebelofte', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 1429083, 'name': 'FashionWeek Nederland', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C560BAQHmyi5VmnYnMQ/company-logo_400_400/0/1527256381895?e=1700092800&v=beta&t=XySCY8UJsaL_90ZUPa9cqhByxYYADG2BqHT-5RQysCo', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/amsterdam-international-fashion-week/', 'employees': {'start': 11, 'end': 50}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2010}, 'end': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Amsterdam', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}, 'end': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}}, 'company': 'Amsterdam Fashion Week', 'description': "Within this position at FashionWeek Nederland I was responsible for the Marketing Partnerships realised with sponsors and for Concept Development in the broadest sense. 
I developed the concept for the organisation’s public programme 'Downtown' and run its platform for talent and innovation 'Fashion LAB' and business programme,  but also independently realise initiatives that will strengthen the positioning and brand identity of FashionWeek Nederland and its main biannual event, Mercedes-Benz FashionWeek Amsterdam.", 'title': 'Manager of Marketing Partnerships and Concept Development', 'employment_type': None}, {'location': 'Amsterdam', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}, 'end': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}}, 'company': 'Amsterdam Fashion Week', 'description': "In this role I developed and financed (through sponsoring / grants) concepts and initiatives which structured FashionWeek Nederland’s Business, Consumer and Sustainability programmes. I was also responsible for the realisation of these programmes with my project team. 

The Green Collective was a major project in this role. Other projects belonging to FashionWeek Nederland's programmes and for which I was ultimately responsible were among others:

Business: Fashion In Business network, Fashion Fasterclass, Pitch Meeting, Daring Designers
Consumer: Downtown, Roadshow, Pop-Up Catwalks, Fashion Drinks
